page.title: 08Changing Times
page.content: {Hillesley: Past & Present. }Having lived in Hillesley all my life (60+ years) I have seen many changes, some for the better and some perhaps not so good. Years ago the village consisted mostly of small cottages having only two bedrooms, living room and kitchen, yet the families were sometimes very large. Water was not always laid on, it had to be carried from stand pipes. Coal and wood fires were the only means of heating and cooking; lighting by oil lamps and candles. Before the 1914/18 war there were a few street lamps run on acetylene gas piped from local premises. Electricity arrived in 1950/51 and the main sewer as recently as 1978. The church and chapel were always well attended with families going to services every Sunday. Sadly, the attendance is not so great despite an extra 40 houses.
